title: BBC Local Live: Nottinghamshire on Thursday 5 January 2017 - BBC News
summary: nottingham supermarket worker on trial over terrorism charges .
dead horse found in woodland car park .
rainworth residents upset over traveller site plans .
it 's 80 years since murder of newark girl changed the law .
american consortium want answers on forest takeover delay .
notts duo head to cambridge to join former manager .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: live updates for nottinghamshire have finished for the day but we 'll be back at 08:00 tomorrow with all the latest news , sport , travel and weather .

documents.title: weather : a cloudy but cold night
text: there will be more cloud around tonight than there was last night .
however it 'll still be cold with lows of -1c ( 30f )
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: latest headlines for nottinghamshire
text: latest headlines for nottinghamshire
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: travel : old clipstone crash causing delays
text: there 's an accident near the roadworks on mansfield road in old clipstone that 's causing some delays this evening .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: us businessmen want answers on forest takeover delay
text: the american consortium set to buy nottingham forest say they want to know the reasons for the delay in completing the takeover .
the bbc understands the group , led by john jay moores , was ready to finalise the deal on 22 december but are still waiting for the final sign-off from current owner fawaz al hasawi .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: checkout worker denies terrorism charges
text: news has more on the story of mr counsell who is on trial in london over terrorism offences .
the court has heard today the married father-of-one searched for flights to the philippines and eventually booked a ticket from heathrow .
he was due to fly out for two days after his arrest last july .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: watch : the latest on forest takeover
text: east midlands today sports editor natalie jackson and bbc radio nottingham 's robin chipperfield have been discussing the forest takeover on facebook .
watch what they had to say .
author: BBC Nottingham Sport

documents.title: smith to be in charge for weekend
text: sticking with notts
we 're with alan smith who expects to be in charge for this weekend only .
he said he wo n't be himself to play .
author: BBC Nottingham Sport

documents.title: asda worker : extremist documents were 'academic research '
text: the court has heard police found mr counsell had downloaded an al-qaeda magazine .
mr counsell told police he downloaded extremist documents for academic research , so he could counter extremism .
he said the military equipment was for `` airsoft '' , a game similar to paintballing , and that he was travelling to the philippines for aid work .
author: Jeremy Ball
Social affairs correspondent, BBC East Midlands Today

documents.title: man searched for flights to philippines
text: the jury at woolwich crown court has heard today that mr counsell made an online search for `` cheap flights from nottingham to zamboanga '' - a city in the philippines where a jihadi group is based .
author: Jeremy Ball
Social affairs correspondent, BBC East Midlands Today

documents.title: shrewsbury sign notts winger rodman
text: here 's more on the news that shrewsbury town have signed notts county winger alex rodman .
he 's joined them on an 18-month deal .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: jury shown is videos
text: the jury is now being shown is propaganda videos found at mr counsell 's home in russell road , forest fields .
author: Jeremy Ball
Social affairs correspondent, BBC East Midlands Today

documents.title: defendant bought military equipment and clothing
text: woolwich crown court has heard mr counsell bought military equipment , and booked a flight to the philippines to join an islamist extremist group .
the prosecution say he bought clothing designed to protect against knives and shrapnel from explosions .
he is also accused of possessing terrorist documents .
author: Jeremy Ball
Social affairs correspondent, BBC East Midlands Today

documents.title: supermarket worker on trial over terrorism charges
text: a nottingham supermarket cashier has gone on trial accused of preparing to fight for an islamist terrorist group .
ryan counsell , a 28-year-old muslim convert , worked at asda in hyson green .
he has denied four terrorism charges .
author: Jeremy Ball
Social affairs correspondent, BBC East Midlands Today

documents.title: charity offers reward over horse death
text: the horse , a grey mare , was thought to have been in labour and was left at the site some time between 18:30 and 19:00 yesterday .
the walker reported the discovery to nottinghamshire police , rspca and charity help for horses .
local veterinary surgeon janice dixon , who runs the charity , has offered a £ 2,000 reward for any information that leads to a conviction .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: body of horse found dumped in car park
text: the body of a horse has been found by the entrance to the watchwood car park off gravelly hollow in calverton .
it was discovered last night by a woman walking her dog .
the rspca said it appears to have been dumped by someone and is asking for people 's help to find out who owns it .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: rodman released by notts
text: notts midfielder alex rodman has been released by the club to join shrewsbury town .
the news was confirmed by the magpies with a short statement on their website .
author: BBC Nottingham Sport

documents.title: chairman has 'unanimous support ' of board
text: the former west yorkshire police chief constable had been accused of overseeing a `` catalogue of governance and operational failures '' .
following the vote , mr ashley ( below ) said in a statement : `` keith has my full backing and will be continuing in his role on the basis that he has the unanimous support of the board .
`` i note that many of those who voted against keith have acknowledged that we have made positive progress since the agm . ''
the company has been under fire during the past 18 months over conditions for its workers at its shireberook warehouse and governance issues .
author: Alex Smith
BBC News Online

documents.title: sports direct chairman stays despite revolt
text: sports direct chairman keith hellawell will stay on at the retailer - despite 54 % voting against his reappointment , the press association reports .
mr hellawell received the backing of 80.92 % of all shareholders , which includes founder and newcastle united football club boss mike ashley - who owns 55 % of the company .
today 's vote was triggered after more than half of the firm 's independent shareholders voted against mr hellawell 's reappointment in september .
author: Alex Smith
BBC News Online

documents.title: adlington shows support for cox after funding cut
text: mansfield swimmer rebecca adlington has said she can not understand why paralympian kadeena cox has had her funding cut while she appears on channel 4 's the jump .
adlington suffered a shoulder injury during the last series and gymnast beth tweddle needed surgery when she was injured in training .
adlington said : `` it 's amazing for kadeena , and all paralympians , to show that she is n't held back from her life .
`` they [ british athletics ] should 've been helping her with this and raising her profile more . ''
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: latest headlines for nottinghamshire
text: latest headlines for nottinghamshire
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: did you notice the armed officers ?
text: did you notice a difference with the armed police patrols in nottinghamshire over the past two weeks ?
let us know your thoughts .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: we could see armed officers again
text: ch supt howick said the visible patrols were to reassure people and act as a deterrent .

officers have now returned to their usual , less visible style of policing but ch supt howick said the force `` can not rule out the possibility of using overtly armed patrols again in the future . ''
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: operation had 'overwhelming response '
text: in nottinghamshire the armed officers could be seen around winter wonderland in market square and at mansfield town and nottingham forest football matches .
ch supt ian howick said : the overwhelming response from the public , both on social media and face to face with the officers themselves , was very positive .
our aim was to alert people , not alarm them , and i hope we achieved that . ''
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: armed police patrols ended
text: a special operation by nottinghamshire police , which saw armed officers patrolling busy and crowded areas in the region over the festive period , has ended .
officers also patrolled parts of leicestershire , lincolnshire and northamptonshire in response to the suspected terrorist attack on a christmas market in berlin .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: racetrack-maker 'living the dream '
text: tom first made a replica of nottingham 's old market square three years ago for his local pub and his career in building scalextric tracks has spiralled from there .
he told bbc east midlands today it has was hard not to love playing with toy cars for a living .
he said : `` it fulfils every geeky and artistic notion that i may have . ''
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: man builds scalextric career
text: what started as a bit of fun in the pub with friends has opened up a whole new career for tom hall .
he started creating bespoke racing car models from it and has even had a commission from the crown prince of abu dhabi .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: dog rewarded by top judge
text: police dog akie has been given a special commendation by a judge .
he was recognised with the award after he tracked down a man who had fled from officers during a chase and discovered him in a field more than a mile away .
akie , is a three-and-a-half year old german shepherd and has worked for nottinghamshire police for two-and-a-half years .
he 's here with his handler pc mark haywood .

documents.title: travel : traffic lights out for repairs
text: a611 annesley rd / hucknall rd lights are out for planned works by wpd .
back on after 3pm today .

documents.title: girl 's disappearance shocked the nation
text: it is 80 years since mona tinsley disappeared in a case which shocked newark-on-trent and the whole country .
for hundreds of years , it was impossible to convict someone of murder without a body .
but the tangled case of mona , the former lodger , the cheating wife and england 's most famous psychic played a part in bringing this idea crashing down .
author: Greig Watson
Reporter, BBC News Online

documents.title: the lost newark girl who helped change the law
text: it was a murder which enthralled a nation , saw police turn to the supernatural and helped change the very law itself .
the disappearance of 10-year-old mona tinsley from newark saw police forces change their principle of 'no body , no murder ' .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: notts duo join former manager at cambridge
text: having left notts county over the past couple of weeks mick halsall and kevin pilkington have linked up with former magpies manager shaun derry at cambridge united
halsall was academy manager while pilkington was goalkeeping coach .
author: David Jackson
BBC Radio Nottingham Sport

documents.title: council has quota of sites to find
text: newark and sherwood district council said it had been told by the government it needed to find 25 permanent pitches for travellers between 2013 and 2018 , and a further 14 between 2018 and 2023 .
just four have been delivered so far .
this site ( if approved ) could take that total to 12 .
author: Christian Hewgill
Reporter, BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: 'residents have no need to be frightened '
text: eleanor overton , who is handling the application for the land-owner , said she understood the concerns some residents had about the plans but there were good and bad people in every society .
`` this community has been incredibly and unfairly stereotyped there 's no need to be frightened , '' she said .
she said the proposal was for derelict scrubland that needed to be `` brought back into use '' .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: residents vow to fight traveller site plans
text: reg bates from raid ( rainworth against inappropriate developments ) said the proposed land had `` deteriorated from a pleasant area '' and residents did not want travellers on the site .
another resident , linda bates , told bbc radio nottingham : `` i 'm not happy about it and we will fight it as far as we can . ''
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: moores tells journalist he has high hopes for forest
text: you can have a full read of barry bloom 's article on john jay moores , here .
in it he says he has recently been flooded with tweets from forest fans with questions about how he thinks moores will run the team .
moores tells him : `` the aspiration is get back to the epl we plan on doing what it takes to get there . ''
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: what 's the latest on forest takeover ?
text: john jay moores has been speaking with barry bloom - a journalist in america who 's become good friends with moores since his reporting of his old club , the san diego padres .
in the interview he 's indicated his concern at the lack of ceo and general manager-types at forest but said : `` we have some folks on the ground .
they 're ready to roll . ''
he admits he does n't know anything about `` soccer '' but then says he did n't know about baseball either before taking over the padres .
asked how he 'd run the club he replied `` hands off it 's just too hard .
it just might be the natural order of things for fans to dislike ownership if somebody does his job right , nobody should even know who 's the owner .
nobody should even care . ''
author: David Jackson
BBC Radio Nottingham Sport

documents.title: latest headlines for nottinghamshire
text: latest headlines for nottinghamshire
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: fears reflect stereoty views , says landowner
text: residents living nearby have raised concerns and have told bbc nottingham they will dispute the plans .
but the applicant said any fears of antisocial behaviour are unfounded and reflect stereoty views of the traveller community .
people have until 25 january to make their views on the application known to newark and sherwood district council .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: plan submitted for new traveller site
text: plans have been revealed for a new travellers ' site near churchfield drive in rainworth .
the land is only accessible through a small country road and has been bought by a traveller who wants to make it home to nine families .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: watch : thursday 's weather outlook
text: a cold and frosty start to what should be a dry and bright day with plenty of sunshine and light winds .
highs of 4c ( 39f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: travel : roads getting busy
text: there 's a lot of slow traffic about on the major roads around nottinghamshire this morning .
check your journey before you travel .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: join us for today 's updates
text: here 's a wintery scene from misterton taken by one of our weather watchers yesterday .
it 's another frosty start today so expect more scenes like this as it gets lighter .
today i 'll have the full weather forecast coming up as well as news of people opposing a traveller site in rainworth .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online
